title: Broly46
author: Broly46
content: What to do with all guy who loss money to stock marketThey are all promised to have retirement, stable and passive income, happy ending, fast car, fast house, fast woman, big fat profit, millionaire, high risk high return. Some of them got into big loan and loss everything, while they are still having to pay their loan. Are they gonna get a refund? The broker tell me stock market would make a come back again, it is just a cycle thing, technical correction, everybody would get their refund when market come back again. Now is the best time to buy low, when they market come back, it is your chance to retire young retire rich.I told broker this is snake oil, and it is over. He respond it is not, you see, everybody too is doing this shady business, everybody doing it, you know, ape together ape is strong, when ape is strong, police is weak, law enforcement is weak, they can't fight the ape when ape together.

comments.author: koleusdat
comments.body: This is roulette, you can always wait for the market to roll back, there is a chance that things will get even worse. There is only risk and they are not afraid to lose everything they have invested. Many have lived for priceless, just not to go into the negative. No one will pay anything.

comments.author: Lorence.xD
comments.body: Bro promises from other people doesn't guarantee that would be accurate and sure. That's why it's not recommended to put money that you would be needing soon especially taking a loan in investment. There's always a risk it's true that stock market might increase and decrease in just period of time, so loss doesn't make you a loser and it's true that you could still recover by learning from your mistakes. Just know your timing when to enter and leave the market and always do your own analysis.

comments.author: Jawhead999
comments.body: Remember, any kind of investment is always carrying a risk.Investing in stock or precious metal you bought on a centralized site will always have a risk of centralization, it's either the business is shady, the site get hacked etc. Investing in physical precious metal has a risk of getting robbed because it's impossible to hide it from anyone else. If you invest in Bitcoin, you can avoid the risk I mentioned before, but it has a risk of lose access to your wallet or someone you trust are betray you.

comments.author: inthelongrun
comments.body: The stock market won't make stable and passive income. Maybe in a bullish season and a growing world economy, these stocks will generate a lot of dividends and their value increases. But the market will never be consistent forever, it will have its own highs and lows. I am not very good at assessing the global stock market, but in my country, I am losing hope that I might transfer them all in crypto this year or early next year before the bitcoin halving. Before, I keep on hearing from some local stock traders and investors in my country about the volatility of crypto. But now my stocks are in worse condition than bitcoin and the other top altcoins like ethereum.

He respond it is not, you see, everybody too is doing this shady business, everybody doing it, you know, ape together ape is strong, when ape is strong, police is weak, law enforcement is weak, they can't fight the ape when ape together. Since a long time ago this brokerage business was quite evil. They promise all kinds of beautiful things to their customers just for profit. They make every effort to ensure that their clients keep investing, even when they lose money. Usually these brokers will say that the loss is reasonable because of market conditions and it will recover, even though their goal is only a percentage of each investment of their customers. In fact, what I hear is that the employees of this broker usually party or do luxury shopping when they get big investments from their clients, and that's quite normal in the brokerage business.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: The crazy part about the stock market is every young guy thinks he is going to get in and trade himself a couple % in profits per day and be rich in a year. It just doesn’t work like that. Those people get bled dry. Unfortunately, it takes age and wisdom to see that being debt free and slowly building a portfolio of dependable companies or index funds is truly the way to reach financial freedom. Slow and steady…

comments.author: avikz
comments.body: Stock market never promises a happy retirement and the other things you have mentioned in your thread. Rather stock market always says - "Investments are subject to market risk". What else can stock market do to be more fair? Stock market is a long term game. I invest quite heavily into it and forgot the investments for next 10 years. Very moderately, I am sitting at around 20% net profit excluding the dividends which are another tax free source of income which I get every quarter. You just need to play it right to win the game!

comments.author: libert19
comments.body: Promises are there to lure customers. They become invalidated with terms 'your investment is subject to market risks'. It's just bear market and such are also usual responses, even I myself see giving this response when I suggest some coin to friend and it collapses

comments.author: dothebeats
comments.body: It’s a cyclical thing: you buy some at the right time and you get out when you have enough. The problem is, if you’re not in the inner circles you probably won’t know what you’re doing half the time, and that could potentially lead you to losing a lot of money on stocks trading. That is how most of the other stock traders make money when the market is bad, by taking advantage of those who are not in the know and sell their garbage to them.Stock trading obviously isn’t for everyone, but once you get the grasp of how the system works, and made connections in this world, better use that as a leverage to your trading journey.

comments.author: kryptqnick
comments.body: I've checked the US stock market index and S&P 500, and it doesn't seem to me that anything particularly bad is going on there. They're all a bit down, but just a tiny bit. In that case, it really depends on what exactly a person invested in, and whether that stock has a history of going up and down and then recovering again. I mean, maybe the problem is that someone was simply scammed, or invested in something very bad and risky. The promises the op mentions certainly sound like a part of a scam. I'm sorry for the loss, but I don't know what can be done in a particular situation because there aren't any details. But if it's a sure loss and there's no way of getting any of that money back, I think it's best to move on, learn to be more careful, and remember that money isn't everything.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: The stock market is one of the ways in which you invest your surplus money and without dividing those investments, you will inevitably lose your money at one point or another. Therefore, whatever the stockbroker promises, you must diversify your investments in sectors that are not affected by each other or adversely affected, such as Gold/USD pair or USD/Real estate pair, and therefore not Your investment portfolio must contain Gold, USD, foreign currencies, Real estate, Stocks and any intermediary investments.If you are in the prime of life, stay away from the advice of the broker and invest in technology companies, companies that reduce the number of employees, and that provide services that society needs in the short and medium term.But if you are old, invest in the shares of large companies that have more than 20 years in the market. These companies have lived after many shocks and mastered how they will stand in the future.Of course, the return is different between both types of stocks.
